radiographic_examinations.findings: Lacelike appearance of the iliac crest, generalized platyspondyly, accessory ossification centers of the first metacarpals.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Radiographic abnormalities in the iliac crest seem to increase with advancing age.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Broad foramen of the vertebral artery at C-2, extending deep into both pedicles.
Severe atlantoaxial instability with anterior and posterior atlantoaxial intervals in flexion being 7 mm and 10 mm, respectively.

radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Evidence of solid fusion was demonstrated during follow-up examinations at 2, 4, 12, 24, and 36 weeks postoperatively.
